alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 12 at 7:39PM EDT until July 13 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. For the Lake Memphremagog...including Coventry...Minor flooding is forecast until 2 AM Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast until 2 AM Thursday. * WHERE...Barton River near Coventry. * WHEN...Until 2 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will continue to flood along with extensive field and lowlandflooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Bankful stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EDT Wednesday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 7.5 feet late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 04/20/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 500 AM EDTlate tonight at 500 AM EDT.
